content: The Act may be cited as the "Affordable Access to Prescription Medications Act of 2009". Medicare Part D prescription drug plans are addressed in the Act. The "Affordable Access to Prescription Medications Act of 2009" amends Section 1860D-2(b)(4) of the Social Security Act to provide additional protections for co-payment or coinsurance requirements for prescription drug plans starting in 2011. The Affordable Access to Prescription Medications Act of 2009 amends Section 1860D-2(b)(4) of the Social Security Act to limit co-payment or coinsurance for covered part D drugs to $200 per month for a single drug and $500 per month for all drugs combined. These amounts will be adjusted annually based on the percentage increase or decrease in costs. The Affordable Access to Prescription Medications Act of 2009 amends Section 1860D-2(b)(4) of the Social Security Act to limit co-payment or coinsurance for covered part D drugs. Effective for plan years beginning on or after January 1, 2011, the Secretary shall expand the formulary tier exception request process for individuals enrolled in prescription drug plans. The Affordable Access to Prescription Medications Act of 2009 modifies the Social Security Act to allow individuals in prescription drug plans to request exceptions for specialty drugs. The Affordable Access to Prescription Medications Act of 2009 allows exceptions for specialty drugs in Medicare Part D plans, including an analysis of specialty tiers' impact on access to care for beneficiaries. The Medicare Payment Advisory Commission will submit a report to Congress within a year of the Act's enactment, detailing the study on utilization effects and recommendations for legislation. The Secretary will issue revised guidance on the use of mechanisms for prescription drug plans under Medicare Part D based on the study results.
